'Bengaluru International Airport' is an international airport serving the Indian
city of Bangalore. The airport is located south of Devanahalli and is from the
central business district of Bangalore, ( from the Bangalore City Railway
Station [http://www.aai.aero/public_notices/0021-2008.pdf
Aerodrome Geographical and Administrative Data] ) and covers . It replaced the HAL airport. For the financial year
2011â12, it was the fourth busiest airport in the country in terms of overall
passenger traffic of 12.69 million and fifth busiest in terms of international
passenger traffic. [http://www.aai.aero/traffic_news/mar2k11annex3.pdf AAI
traffic figures 2010â2011] It has been awarded "India's best airport" for
the year 2011 by the survey conducted by Skytrax.

The airport handled about 12.6 million passengers and had air traffic movements
(ATM) of about 330 per day in the year 2011. The airport is expected
to handle 18 million passengers in the year 2015. It is host to 10 domestic
airlines and 21 international airlines connecting the city to about 50
destinations across India and rest of the world and served as a hub for debt
ridden Kingfisher Airlines until 20 October 2012 and serves as a focus city for
Jet Airways, JetLite, IndiGo, SpiceJet, GoAir. Former Air Deccan also had its
base at BIA.

On 18 July 2013, the airport's name was changed to Kempegowda International
Airport after the Union Government approved the Government of Karnataka's
proposal to rename the airport after Kempe Gowda I, the founder of
Bangalore.
